KeyboardEventKeyCode.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The deprecated KeyboardEvent.keyCode read-only property represents a system and implementation dependent numerical code identifying the unmodified value of the pressed key.

remarks.para: This is usually the decimal ASCII ({{RFC(20)}}) or Windows 1252 code corresponding to the key. If the key can't be identified, this value is 0.

You should avoid using this if possible; it's been deprecated for some time. Instead, you should use , if it's implemented. Unfortunately, some browsers still don't have it, so you'll have to be careful to make sure you use one which is supported on all target browsers.

blockquote.para: Note: Web developers shouldn't use the keyCode attribute for printable characters when handling keydown and keyup events. As described above, the keyCode attribute is not useful for printable characters, especially those input with the <kbd>Shift</kbd> or <kbd>Alt</kbd> key pressed. When implementing a shortcut key handler, the event is usually better (at least when Gecko is the runtime in use).
